caption:
This photograph depicts an environmental scene featuring a heavily silted, reddish-orange water body, possibly a river or stream. The water appears thick with sediment and pollution, suggesting contamination or erosion issues in the area. Surrounding the water are muddy, similarly colored banks cluttered with debris, including plastic waste and bits of metal, indicative of human pollution.

The setting is likely outdoors under bright sunlight, as indicated by the vivid colors and shadows in the image. Vegetation is visible with some green leaves hanging into the frame from the top right corner, contrasting starkly with the polluted ground. The overall scene communicates a sense of environmental degradation and neglect, highlighting issues related to water pollution and ecosystem disruption. The photograph serves as a stark visual testament to the impact of industrial or urban waste on natural water bodies.
title: Water draining from old mining areas gives the Kanawha its ruddy color. Mile Branch near Cedar Grove flows into the Kanawha.
